---
title: HTML Sanitize
description: Ensure that we strip dangerous attributes from authored HTML in Markdown.
author: jeahyoun
ms.date: 02/24/2020
layout: LandingPage
ms.topic: landing-page
---

# Checking Sanitize functionality

Onload attributes in images (and all other tags) should be stripped. If they haven't, this page will show a Javascript alert on load.

<img onload="javascript:alert('hacked')"  alt="You have been hacked" src="data:image/jpeg;base64," />

This example is taken from this live page: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/architecture/architectures/example-workloads

<a class="button" href="reference-architectures">Reference Architectures</a>
<a class="button" href="example-workloads">Example Workloads</a>
<a class="button is-primary" href="index">Solution Ideas</a>

loadjs(['/azure/architecture/_js/external/handlebars.min-v4.5.1.js',
    '/azure/architecture/_js/architectures/architectures.css',
    '/azure/architecture/_js/architectures/architectures.js?version=202001060533'
    ], 'scripts',
{
    async: false,
    numRetries: 3,
    returnPromise: true
});
">

## Code blocks

Code blocks will also be sanitized, unfortunately. However, the impact should be minimal if possible.

This example is taken from this live page: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/bingmaps/v8-web-control/creating-and-hosting-map-controls/creating-a-basic-map-control

```html
<body onload="GetMap();">

var map = new Microsoft.Maps.Map('#myMap');
```
